meta.title: Welcome to Sovryn
meta.description: The largest Bitcoin DeFi dapp - trading, lending, yield farming and home to the Origins cross-chain launchpad.

first.title: Connect your wallet
first.description: Sovryn supports the most popular browser and hardware wallets.

second.title: Deposit funds
second.description: Transfer funds to your address from our selection of bridges.

third.title: Start earning
third.description: Enjoy permisionless and decentralized trading keeping the full control of your funds.

first.title: What is Sovryn?
first.description: Sovryn is a decentralized exchange built on bitcoin. Use your bitcoin to trade, borrow, lend, and earn income. Sovryn is a DAO and the most feature-rich DeFi platform for bitcoin.

second.title: On which blockchain does Sovryn operate?
second.description:
Sovryn currently operates on two chains—BOB and Rootstock.

<0>BOB (Build on Bitcoin) — a hybrid Layer-2 rollup secured by bitcoin and natively connected to Ethereum. It uses the Ethereum Virtual Machine.

<1>Rootstock (RSK)—a smart-contract, merge-mined sidechain of bitcoin. Its engine is a forked version of the Ethereum Virtual Machine.

Both BOB and Rootstock are compatible with Ethereum smart contracts and the tools used to deploy and interact with them.

third.title: How do I get funds into Sovryn?
third.description:
On BOB, you can use the bridge interface to bring in assets from Ethereum and to bridge in BTC from the bitcoin network.

On Rootstock, you can bridge in stablecoins with Babelfish and other assets from Ethereum and BSC using the Sovryn bridge.

fourth.title: What is the native gas token?
fourth.description:
On BOB, the native currency is ETH, which must be used for gas for transactions. Soon you will be able to use other assets to pay for gas as well.

On Rootstock, the native currency is RBTC, which must be used for gas for transactions. RBTC is pegged 1:1 with BTC.

fifth.title: What can I do on the Sovryn dapp?
fifth.description: You can trade, swap, provide liquidity, stake, lend, or borrow funds.

pricesBy24hChange.title: Prices by 24h change
pricesBy24hChange.marketCapTooltip:
Market cap is calculated as circulating supply * current USD price.

For SOV, circulating supply = total supply (100m) - tokens in vesting contracts, <0>not including tokens in adoption and development fund contracts.

For RBTC, circulating supply = BTC locked in the RSK 2 Way Peg

For all other tokens, circulating supply = total supply

For tokens that have come across a bridge from another chain, the circulating supply is the supply of that token on the RSK chain. For example, the circulating supply of ETHs is not equal to the circulating supply of ETH on ethereum.
pricesBy24hChange.circulatingSupplyTooltip: We have updated the circulating supply formula to show the amount of liquid SOV token in line with market standards. SOV that has been unlocked from the adoption and development funds is now counted as circulating, and SOV that has been staked (either through vesting or voluntary staking) is not counted as circulating.
